title: It's not a crime if we do it with an app
author: keepit
aiHeadline: In a shocking turn of events, it's been revealed that if you do something questionable with an app, it's apparently not a crime, because who needs ethics when you have an iPhone, and this latest development has left many wondering if we're living in a real-life episode of Black Mirror where technology has become the ultimate get-out-of-jail-free card.

title: Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion
author: todsacerdoti
aiHeadline: The age-old debate between Wayland and X11 input latency has finally been put to rest with some hard numbers, because what's a few milliseconds of delay when you're trying to get work done, and the real question is, will this settle the argument once and for all or just lead to more endless discussions in the comments section?

title: No Bitcoin ETFs at Vanguard (2024)
author: mooreds
aiHeadline: Vanguard has made it clear that they won't be jumping on the Bitcoin ETF bandwagon anytime soon, citing reasons that probably have nothing to do with the fact that cryptocurrency is still a wild west of uncertainty and volatility, and everything to do with being cautious and not wanting to lose their shirts in the process, but hey, at least they're being honest about it.

title: YC Graveyard: 821 inactive Y Combinator startups
author: memalign
aiHeadline: YC Graveyard is the fascinating and slightly morbid website that's dedicated to cataloging all 821 inactive Y Combinator startups, because who doesn't love a good tale of failure and disappointment, and it's like a trainwreck that you can't look away from, a reminder that even the best ideas can sometimes go horribly wrong.

title: The Microsoft 365 Copilot launch was a disaster
author: belter
aiHeadline: The launch of Microsoft 365 Copilot was supposed to be a grand affair, but it ended up being a disaster of epic proportions, with problems and glitches galore, leaving many to wonder if the company has finally jumped the shark, and the real question is, can they recover from this debacle or is it time to start updating those resumes?
